metadata.key_specifications: Bidirectional TVS diode, IEC 61000-4-2 ESD protection up to ±30kV, IEC 61000-4-5 surge protection up to 20A (8/20μs) with 55V clamping, low 15pF capacitance, 100nA max leakage, -55°C to 150°C temp range, SOT-23 package
metadata.applications: Industrial sensors, 4/20mA loops, lighting, field transmitters & sensors

page_summaries.content:
TSM36CA Bidirectional Surge Protection Device in SOT-23
1 Features
• IEC 61000-4-2 ESD protection:
– ±30kV contact discharge
– ±30kV air gap discharge
• IEC61000-4-5 surge protection:
– 20A (8/20µs)
– Clamping voltage: 55V at 20A (8/20µs)
• IO capacitance: 15pF (typical)
• Low leakage current of 100nA (maximum)
• Industrial temperature range: -55°C to +150°C
• SOT-23 (DBZ) leaded package to minimize board space and allow for automatic optical inspection (AOI)
2 Applications
• Industrial sensors
• 4/20mA loops
• Lighting
• Field transmitter & sensor
3 Description
The TSM36CA is a 36V, bidirectional TVS protection diode designed for clamping harmful transients such as ESD and surge. The TSM36CA robustly shunts up to 20A of IEC 61000-4-5 fault current to protect systems from high power transients or lightning strikes. The TSM36CA device is rated to dissipate ESD strikes up to ±30kV (contact and air gap discharge) which exceeds the maximum level specified in the IEC 61000-4-2 international standard (Level 4).
Additionally, the TSM36CA is available in a small leaded SOT-23 (DBZ) package which is reduced in size by approximately 50 percent compared to the industry standard SMA package. The extremely low device leakage and capacitance ensures a minimal effect on the protected line.

5.7 Typical Characteristics

[PAGE CONTAINS GRAPHS AND CHARTS VISUALIZING TYPICAL ELECTRICAL CHARACTERISTICS]

6.1 Application Information
TSM36CA is a diode type TVS that provides a path to ground for dissipating transient voltage spikes, such as ESD or surge, on signal lines and power lines. Connect the device in parallel to the down stream circuitry for protection. As the current from the transient passes through the device, only a small voltage drop is present across the diode. This is the voltage presented to the protected IC. The low RDYN of the triggered TVS holds this voltage (VCLAMP) to a safe level for the protected IC. For more information on how to properly use this device, refer to the ESD Packaging and Layout Guide for details.

One comon example of implementing TSM36CA is to protect both sides of a PLC module and a sensor transmitter, as shown in the figure below.

[DIAGRAM SHOWING TYPICAL APPLICATION CIRCUIT]

Product Summary.content: The TSM36CA is a 36V, bidirectional TVS protection diode designed for clamping harmful transients such as ESD and surge. It provides IEC 61000-4-2 ESD protection up to ±30kV contact and air gap discharge, and IEC 61000-4-5 surge protection up to 20A (8/20µs) with a clamping voltage of 55V at 20A (8/20µs).

The TSM36CA is a low capacitance (15pF typical) and low leakage current (100nA maximum) device suitable for industrial applications like sensors, 4/20mA loops, lighting, and field transmitters/sensors. It operates across an industrial temperature range of -55°C to +150°C.

The TSM36CA comes in a compact SOT-23 (DBZ) leaded package that minimizes board space and allows for automatic optical inspection (AOI). Its small size is approximately 50% smaller than the industry standard SMA package.

The TSM36CA robustly shunts up to 20A of IEC 61000-4-5 fault current to protect systems from high power transients or lightning strikes. It is rated to dissipate ESD strikes up to ±30kV, exceeding the IEC 61000-4-2 Level 4 maximum specification.

Electrical Characteristics.content: 5.1 Absolute Maximum Ratings: This section provides the maximum ratings for power, current, temperature, and storage conditions that the device can withstand without permanent damage. It includes peak pulse power and current, operating and storage temperature ranges.

5.2 ESD Ratings—JEDEC Specification and 5.3 ESD Ratings—IEC Specification: These sections specify the electrostatic discharge (ESD) ratings for the device according to different standards, such as the JEDEC and IEC specifications. It includes ratings for human body model (HBM), charged device model (CDM), contact discharge, and air-gap discharge.
5.4 Recommended Operating Conditions: This section provides the recommended operating conditions for the device, including input voltage range and operating temperature range.

5.5 Thermal Information: This section provides thermal metrics for the device, such as junction-to-ambient, junction-to-case, and junction-to-board thermal resistances, as well as characterization parameters for different package types.

5.6 Electrical Characteristics: This section specifies the electrical characteristics of the device under various test conditions, including reverse stand-off voltage, breakdown voltage, surge clamping voltage, leakage current, dynamic resistance, and line capacitance.

Application Circuits.content: TSM36CA is a diode type TVS that provides a path to ground for dissipating transient voltage spikes, such as ESD or surge, on signal lines and power lines. Connect the device in parallel to the down stream circuitry for protection. As the current from the transient passes through the device, only a small voltage drop is present across the diode. This is the voltage presented to the protected IC. The low RDYN of the triggered TVS holds this voltage (VCLAMP) to a safe level for the protected IC.
One common example of implementing TSM36CA is to protect both sides of a PLC module and a sensor transmitter, as shown in the figure below. [DIAGRAM SHOWING TYPICAL APPLICATION CIRCUIT]
For more information on how to properly use this device, refer to the ESD Packaging and Layout Guide for details.

Reliability and Environmental Conditions.content: 5.1 Absolute Maximum Ratings: Specifies the maximum allowable operating conditions for temperature, voltage, and current. This includes the operating free-air temperature range (-55°C to 150°C), storage temperature range (-65°C to 155°C), peak pulse power (1400W), and peak pulse current (20A).

5.2 ESD Ratings—JEDEC Specification and 5.3 ESD Ratings—IEC Specification: Defines the electrostatic discharge (ESD) ratings according to JEDEC and IEC standards. This includes the maximum allowed voltages for human body model (HBM), charged device model (CDM), contact discharge, and air-gap discharge.
5.4 Recommended Operating Conditions: Specifies the recommended input voltage range (-36V to 36V) and operating free-air temperature range (-55°C to 150°C) for normal operation.

5.5 Thermal Information: Provides thermal metrics such as junction-to-ambient, junction-to-case, and junction-to-board thermal resistances, as well as junction-to-top and junction-to-board characterization parameters for the specific package.

5.6 Electrical Characteristics: Lists the typical electrical parameters and their values under specific test conditions. This includes reverse stand-off voltage, breakdown voltage, surge clamping voltage, leakage current, dynamic resistance, and line capacitance.
